sub_title: Operations Director Managed Service  at Nokia
summary:
A senior manager, with more than 36 years experience in telecommunications and since January 2013 responsible for Customer Assurance of a large outsourcings contact between Nokia and a Dutch incumbent. Between 2006 and 2013 support and solution design for complex outsourcing / transformational projects in Europe. Wide experience in managed service solution development, contract closure and transition for large outsourcing deals (e.g. Bulgaria) contract extensions (e.g. Germany) and contract reviews (Switzerland and Belgium) 

Personal objective is to support the execution of outsourcing / transformational projects and knowledge transfer in developing counties and Asia.

Specialties:
• Customer Assurance and managing outsourcing contracts  
• Developing and implementing complex outsourcing projects 
• Project and Subcontractor Management 
• Project review and analysis 
• Managing Profit centers 
• Consultative selling

school.name: APICS - American Production and Inventory Control Society

education.field_of_study: Certified in Production and Inventory Control

profile_positions.description:
Operations Director Nokia Managed Service - Responsible for Customer Assurance of a Dutch Telecom Incumbent supporting a 5 year outsourcing contract between this Incumbent and Nokia (Alcatel-Lucent).   Main responsibilities:
- Prime interface/point-of-escalation for outsourcing partner regarding the Nokia’s Managed Services Delivery
- Assure that Nokia is delivering the Quality of Service and Business Continuity in accordance with the contract
- Establish and maintain Governance, Communication and Reporting structure on and tactical level 
- Drive and support continuous improvement covering related to the contracted Managed Services 
- Support and drive Customer Satisfaction  improvement
profile_positions.title: Operations Director Managed Service

profile_positions.description:
Operations Director Nokia Managed Service - Responsible for Customer Assurance of a Dutch Telecom Incumbent supporting a 5 year outsourcing contract between this Incumbent and Nokia (Alcatel-Lucent).   Main responsibilities:
- Prime interface/point-of-escalation for outsourcing partner regarding the Nokia’s Managed Services Delivery
- Assure that Nokia is delivering the Quality of Service and Business Continuity in accordance with the contract
- Establish and maintain Governance, Communication and Reporting structure on and tactical level 
- Drive and support continuous improvement covering related to the contracted Managed Services 
- Support and drive Customer Satisfaction  improvement
profile_positions.title: Operations Director Managed Service

profile_positions.description: Business Development & Sales Support – Europe. Engage with Customer at C- level, typically CTO COO, CFO to understand current mode of operations, constraints, technologies and transformation planning, including business, services, network and operations transformation. Design, develop and sell the outsourcing / transformational solutions covering customer’s network operations, processes, systems, interfaces and organizations.  Perform base line analysis and develop associated costing models and operations models including resource planning. Coordinate the Due Diligence activities and develop Service Level Agreements for recommended solutions and support the contract negotiations, transition and transformation phases.
profile_positions.title: Senior Solutions Architect Managed Services

profile_positions.description: Developing and Implementing the GNOC Concept  and responsible for the Lucent WorldWide Services (LWS), EMEA GNOC performing Remote Network Management Services (Fault Management, Configuration Management, Accounting Management, Performance Management and Security Management) for 18 Major Telecommunication Operators in Europe (including PAN-E) and 12 USA based customers. The technologies managed are voice switching, SDH / DWDM / ATM / IP DSL and Mobile (RAN-CORE-Transport)
profile_positions.title: Director EMEA Global Network Operations Center (GNOC)

profile_positions.description: Senior Project Manager responsible for the implementation of the TEP-6 Long Distance Digital Microwave System (3500 KM microwave). The Project management responsibilities covered System / Radio Engineering, Sub- contractor Management for Civil and Telecommunication implementation, Sub Contract Management, Order and Change Management and prime interface with Saudi Telecom Company (former MoPTT) on Director Level.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager Long Distance Microwave, TEP 6 Project

profile_positions.description: Supported last Quarter ’95, as core sales team member, the GSM O&M contract win for the Operations and Maintenance of the Saudi Telecom Company’s (MoPTT) GSM Network (deployed by Lucent Technologies). Since Feb. 1996, Senior Project Manager / Planning & Engineering Manager responsible for the Implementation of the GSM Operation and Maintenance Organization.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager GSM Operation & Maintenance

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the business development ‘Wireless Professional Services’ in EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) related to GSM, Wireless Local Loop and AMPS network solutions. The business development focus was on Network Design and RF-Engineering, Network implementation and Network Optimization services.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Wireless Professional Services

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Tier 2 Customer Support national and international of Transmission and OS-Transmission Products (PDH, SDH, ATM, and NMS-es) for all 30 channel countries world-wide (warranty and post warranty). In this role, responsible for resource management, priorities, escalation management, dept. budget, capital investments and improvement programs and Customer Relation management for key accounts.
profile_positions.title: Manager International Customer Support Transmission and OS-Transmission

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Technology Transfer (Product Manufacturing and Production Processes) to new AT&T and other 3rd party Factories for Transmission Products (PDH and SDH). New start-up factories in Spain (Tres Cantos), China (Shanghai) were implemented. In addition to these major projects additional production lines were implemented in France, (Rouen-TRT), Italy (Italtel), India, (TATA)  and Mexico (TSP)
profile_positions.title: Manager Technology Transfer Manufacturing Engineering

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the implementation and start-up of the new SMD-JIT production organization in the Manufacturing Huizen for PDH and SDH products. The implementation concerned, kiting area, SMD-shop and three circuit pack assembly lines including process quality and final inspection.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager Transmission Products

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the implementation and start-up of the new 5ESS equipment production concerning cable assembly, unit assembly and cabinet assembly. Due to the growth of the EMEA 5ESS market, the production increased  from 50SMs in 1987 to approx. 800SM’s in 1989. In addition to the SM increase also the CM and AM production increased proportional.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager 5ESS Equipment AT&T

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the production of analogue switching equipment and repair. The product ranges consist of cabinets, cables and units for the PRX-A switch. The production consists of assembly unit test, final assembly and final system test.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager PRX equipment

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Order Acceptance (Master Production Schedule) and Factory Planning for all  PRX-A and in-sourced transmission product. Responsible for the over flow factory loading of the factories in Huizen, Hilversum and Leeuwarden.
profile_positions.title: Manager Planning / Order Acceptance

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Order Acceptance and factory loading for all PRX-A products as interface between the Logistic Management Commercial / Development and the Switching Factory. The acceptance was related to rough cut capacity and material requirements planning (MRP I and II) for flow and non-flow production as well as the detailed factory capacity planning.
profile_positions.title: Manager Order Acceptance
